measured_by: probabilistic foraging game (sequential hunter-gatherer task with predators)
justification: "To study this, we developed a probabilistic foraging game … in which people are prompted to approach or avoid certain dangers…" – indicating the game is the instrument used to measure AAC decision behaviour.

"Bayesian model inference suggests that the multi-heuristic policy performs the best (PEP = 0.98)…" – the fit of the multi-heuristic policy model is treated as the empirical read-out of participants’ reliance on heuristic decision rules.

measured_by: capped optimal policy values model fit
justification: "We were motivated to generate a capped optimal policy value model… The PEP results even show a slight preference of the capped optimal policy values…" – the fit of this model serves as the measure of optimal/MDP-based strategy adoption.
"Next, we tested whether the survival rate … can be predicted by the slope (β1) of the OP values + cap model…" – survival rate is used as the behavioural outcome measure of performance quality.

"We ran a linear regression of the uncertainty of the model predictions for participants' log transformed response times… responses should get slower when decisions are more uncertain/harder." – response time is employed as the observable metric of decision difficulty.
